content: gargantuan melon or necessity breeds invention by carla martin do you like me have a friend or family member with a gargantuan melon do you need to knit that melon a quick gift well here s your solution after searching and not finding exactly what i wanted in a hat for my loved one with a 24 circumference head i whipped one together the beauty of this pattern its so stretchy it will even accommodate much smaller heads one hat to rule them all www mylittletribe com © carla martin 1 materials ● 1 ball wool-ease chunky - main color ● 1 ball wool-ease chunky - contrasting color if desired ● 1 us 10 16 circular or size needed to obtain gauge ● 1 us 10 8 dpns or size needed to obtain gauge ● 4 stitch markers if desired for work on circular needle ● yarn needle gauge 4 inches = 20 st/18 row in 2x2 ribbing un-stretched sizing up to 24 head circumference stitch guide k2tg knit 2 stitches together ssk slip 2 stitches individually as if to knit to the right hand needle pass back to left hand needle and knit together through the back loops directions using long tail method cast on 80 stitches placing stitch marker every 20 stitches or cast on to 4 dpns with 20 stitches on each needle begin 2x2 rib after beginning of round marker k1 p2 k2 p2 4 times k1 slip marker and repeat to end repeat this pattern row until hat reaches 28 row or measures 6 25 inserting contrasting colored row where desired pictured hat has contrasting yarn in row 7 8 11-16 19 20 be creative and add stripes where you want them www mylittletribe com © carla martin 2 next decrease crown as follows 1 ssk work in pattern to last two stitches k2tg slip marker repeat to end in each section 2 work even in pattern repeat these two row switching to dpns when necessary until 8 stitches remain in each section 32 stitches total then repeat decrease row 1 only until 8 stitches total remain finishing break yarn using yarn needle thread yarn tail through 8 remaining stitches and gather pulling taught turn to wrong side and weave in ends gently block wear it gift it the fine print all content and photos are © carla martin all rights reserved this pattern is for personal and non-profit use only
